column4: hey guys, can anyone help me find out why my usb pci card is not working on 8.04?
shure whats lsusb saying?
I am using a belkin 5 port USB 2.0 pci card. My system gives some ata errors and won't boot up
it boots up when I remove the card.
there are ata errors?
yes
ata1 failed to recover some devices is the specific error. It then throws me a initramfs prompt
hmmm have you googled around?
yes, I found that one solution was to edit, /etc/intiramfs-tools/modules .. but I don't even have the initramfs-tools directory under etc
i found that solution on launchpad, bug 104581
hmmmmm
are you sure you dont have the initramfs-tools directory
wait, i see the directory now when I booted up the machine (w/o the card). But the solution is for hard disks. Any other Ideas?
I didn't see the directory when I was in initramfs prompt
i think you should try the fix, it looks like that card is playing around with the ata card so this might work
hehe, why not. I am doing it now :)
make sure to make a backup of copy of the file just in case
I see that it is just some comments right now
right just make a backup up copy in case
and then edit away
I did ;) and now I am done and about to reboot.. brb
